Entry Title: WHID 2024-033: Zee Media website hacked, accused of making ‘fun of the situation’ in Bangladesh
Incident Description: Zee Media Corporation Limited website has been hacked. Bangladeshi hackers group “SYSTEMADMINBD” is behind the cyber hack which accuses the publication of mocking the situation in Bangladesh.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-032: DeFi exchange dYdX v3 website hacked in DNS hijack attack
Incident Description: Decentralized finance (DeFi) crypto exchange dYdX announced on Tuesday that the website for its older v3 trading platform has been compromised.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-031: Bangladesh Chhatra League website hacked amid nationwide unrest
Incident Description: Bangladesh Chhatra League’s official website (https://bsl.org.bd/) has been hacked amid nationwide protests by students and job seekers calling for reforms to the quota system for government jobs.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-030: Russian hackers claim Times of Malta website attack, threaten others
Incident Description:
A short time later, Times of Malta's website was overwhelmed by connection requests, forcing it offline. 

The attack, known as a Distributed Denial of Service, or DDoS, overloaded Times of Malta servers and breached existing protections in place, causing the website to go offline for most readers for around 45 minutes at its peak, after the Telegram group was instructed to "attack". It continued until 10am on Tuesday.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-029: Chinese hackers breached Dutch Ministry of Defense
Incident Description: Chinese state-sponsored hackers have breached the Dutch Ministry of Defense (MOD) last year and deployed a new remote access trojan (RAT) malware to serve as a backdoor.

Entry Title: WHID 2025-028: Ivanti Connect Secure flaw massively exploited by attackers (CVE-2024-21893)
Incident Description: CVE-2024-21893, a server-side request forgery (SSRF) vulnerability affecting Ivanti Connect Secure VPN gateways and Policy Secure (a network access control solution), is being exploited by attackers.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-027: Cloudflare Hacked After State Actor Leverages Okta Breach
Incident Description: CloudFlare Servers Were Hacked on Thanksgiving Day Using Auth Tokens Stolen in Okta Breach.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-026: Cyberattack hits Georgia county where Trump is charged
Incident Description: An unexpected outage has downed the county’s phone systems and brought certain online transactions to a halt, including those filing property tax, firearms and marriage licenses

Entry Title: WHID 2024-025: Manta Network Faces DDoS Attack Shortly After Token Issuance
Incident Description: The network fell victim to a Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack, resulting in prolonged withdrawal times and sluggish network performance. Despite this disruption, Manta’s developers have assured users that their funds remain secure, and efforts are underway to resolve the situation.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-024: Swiss websites hit by DDoS attacks during World Economic Forum in Davos
Incident Description: Swiss websites were hit by a wave of distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks this week, likely orchestrated by pro-Russian hackers.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-023: Ukrainian arrested for infecting US cloud provider with cryptomining malware
Incident Description: Starting in 2021, the suspect infected the servers of “one of the world's largest e-commerce companies” by hacking 1,500 accounts of a subsidiary, the police said. The attacker used self-developed software for an automatic password-testing method known as a brute force attack.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-022: NoName Targets Multiple Websites in Lithuania, Blames it for Aiding Ukraine
Incident Description: Several prominent organizations in Lithuania, including Compensa Vienna Insurance Group, If Insurance, Lithuanian Roads Association, AD REM, INIT, and Balticum, have allegedly fallen victim to the NoName attack. The threat actors, identified as the NoName ransomware group, have been actively sharing posts detailing the impact of the cyberattack on Lithuania websites.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-021: Over 6,700 WordPress Sites Spotted Using Plugin Infected by New Balada Injector Malware
Incident Description: Over 6,700 WordPress websites fell victim to a sophisticated cyber campaign deploying the notorious Balada Injector malware.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-020: Raptor School Safety Software Breach Exposed 4 Million Records Including Highly Sensitive Data
Incident Description: The non-password protected documents were in three separate cloud storage buckets and totaled 4,024,001 records. Upon further research, the documents indicated the database belonged to a Texas-based school security company called Raptor Technologies.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-019: Volexity Catches Chinese Hackers Exploiting Ivanti VPN Zero-Days
Incident Description: Ivanti confirms active zero-day exploits, ships pre-patch mitigations, but says comprehensive fixes won’t be available until January 22.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-018: Hackers seize control of SEC’s X account to promote crypto
Incident Description: The Securities and Exchange Commission said Tuesday an “unknown party” had hacked its official account on the social media platform X to promote bitcoin, the latest of multiple hacks used to push cryptocurrencies.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-017: The Iconic promises to issue refunds to hacked customers
Incident Description:
Online retailer The Iconic has pledged to issue full refunds to customers who have been left out of pocket following a rise in hackers using stolen login details to access their accounts.

The company confirmed it had seen a spike in “credential stuffing” – a method of attack in which hackers use lists of compromised user credentials, such as email and password combinations exposed in separate data breaches, to breach other systems.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-016: loanDepot Cyberattack: Critical Systems Offline as Rapid Response Unfolds
Incident Description:
LoanDepot, a major player in the mortgage lending industry, has fallen victim to a cyber incident, marking the fourth cyberattack on a real estate industry organization in recent months.

The company issued a statement to its customers on its official website, acknowledging the cyberattack on loanDepot and revealing that specific systems have been taken offline as part of their efforts to address the situation promptly.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-015: Cyberattack Hits Maldives Government: Websites Recover Amid Diplomatic Tensions
Incident Description: Over the weekend, the Maldives faced a cyberattack, resulting in the temporary unavailability of the official websites of the President’s office, Foreign Ministry, and Tourism Ministry. Users attempting to access these sites encountered disruptions for several hours on Saturday night.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-014: Bangladesh official alleges cyberattack ‘from Ukraine and Germany’ targeted election
Incident Description: An official at the Bangladesh Election Commission has claimed that a cyberattack “from Ukraine and Germany” caused an election information app to crash as voters went to the polls on Sunday.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-013: Hacked X accounts with gold checkmarks are for sale on the dark web, says study
Incident Description: The most common targets of the sellers of gold X accounts are organizational accounts that have remained dormant since before 2022. One of the techniques they try is to brute force the credentials of these accounts using credential stuffing tools like Open Bullet, SilverBullet, and SentryMBA. Once a complete account takeover is done through changing recovery email and contact details, the thieves pay to convert the account to gold status, and put it up for sale.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-012: Orange Spain taken offline following massive cyberattack caused by "ridiculously weak" password
Incident Description: Orange Spain has suffered a major outage earlier this week after a threat actor going by the alias “Snow” obtained a “ridiculously weak” password for an account that manages the global routing table and controls the networks that deliver the company’s internet traffic.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-011: Alleged Phoenix Group DDoS Attack Disrupts US Congress Website
Incident Description: The hacking group Phoenix has claimed responsibility for a Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack on the website of the US Congress. The hacker group posted a message asserting that the congressional website had been disabled, specifically targeting pages related to lobbying and online reporting in the United States.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-010: 23andMe tells victims it’s their fault that their data was breached
Incident Description: The data breach started with hackers accessing only around 14,000 user accounts. The hackers broke into this first set of victims by brute-forcing accounts with passwords that were known to be associated with the targeted customers, a technique known as credential stuffing.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-009: DoorDash hacker took hundreds of dollars from her account
Incident Description: A few days later, DoorDash said it confirmed Rivas' account had been taken over by a hacker and that it believed the vulnerability may have caused by her personal email account.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-008: Mandiant, the security firm Google bought for $5.4 billion, gets its X account hacked
Incident Description: Google-owned security firm Mandiant spent several hours trying to regain control of its account on X (formerly known as Twitter) on Wednesday after an unknown scammer hijacked it and used it to spread a link that attempted to steal cryptocurrency from people who clicked on it.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-007: Hacker Threatens Colima State Congress with Database Leak
Incident Description: A threat actor has come forward claiming to have leaked a database and executed SQL injection for the H. Congress of the State of Colima in Mexico

Entry Title: WHID 2024-006: This dangerous malware is able to hijack your Google Account by reviving cookies
Incident Description: A serious exploit affecting Google services that is being used to grant threat actors access to Google Accounts has been uncovered by cybersecurity company CloudSEK.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-005: MULTIPLE ORGANIZATIONS IN IRAN WERE BREACHED BY A MYSTERIOUS HACKER
Incident Description: Hudson Researchers reported that on December 20th, a hacker using the moniker ‘irleaks’ announced the availability for sale of over 160,000,000 records allegedly stolen from 23 leading insurance companies in Iran.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-004: Cyber attack on Victoria's court system may have exposed recordings of sensitive cases
Incident Description:
Victoria's court system has been hit by a ransomware attack, which an independent expert believes was orchestrated by Russian hackers.

A spokesperson for Court Services Victoria (CSV) said hackers accessed an area of the court system's audio-visual archive. That would mean recordings of hearings including witness testimony from highly sensitive cases may have been accessed or stolen.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-003: Government’s main server faces cyberattacks
Incident Description: Nepal government’s main server has faced cyberattacks leading to disruptions of hundreds of government websites across the country on Monday.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-002: Anonymous Sudan Allegedly Attacks Twitch, But Is It Real?
Incident Description: Users of the live streaming app might encounter service disruptions, rendering it inaccessible for watching live streams.

Entry Title: WHID 2024-001: Alleged DDoS Rampage: NoName Targets Multiple Finnish Organizations
Incident Description: The notorious NoName ransomware group, believed to have Russian connections, has reportedly launched a series of cyberattacks targeting several Finnish government organizations in its latest spree. As a consequence of these alleged NoName cyberattacks on Finland-based entities, the websites of multiple victims experienced temporary inaccessibility.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-015: Hours-long disruption to Singapore public hospitals' websites caused by DDoS attack
Incident Description: An hours-long disruption that affected the websites of Singapore's public healthcare institutions on Wednesday (Nov 1) was caused by a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-014: Okta breach: 134 customers exposed in October support system hack
Incident Description: Okta says attackers who breached its customer support system last month gained access to files belonging to 134 customers, five of them later being targeted in session hijacking attacks with the help of stolen session tokens.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-013: Suspected DDoS attack impacts AP news site
Incident Description: The Associated Press reports that its news website was impacted by an outage believed to be caused by a distributed denial-of-service attack.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-012: RANSOMWARERansomware Gang Takes Credit for Disruptive MGM Resorts Cyberattack
Incident Description: A known ransomware gang has taken credit for the highly disruptive cyberattack on MGM Resorts, and the hospitality and entertainment giant has yet to restore many of the impacted systems.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-011: Tesla owner warning others after being locked out of car, account hacked
Incident Description:
Falzon says Haider, and other Tesla owners, should set up multi-factor authentication which could have prevented the hack. It requires users to go through additional steps to access their accounts.

“This is really a cybersecurity issue related to authentication. Not so much specific to the vehicle itself,” Falzon said, noting as more vehicles move to app-based access, this won’t be a problem for just Tesla owners.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-010: South African News Website Says it Faced Cyber Attack After Publishing Report on Modi
Incident Description:
“Since publishing, Daily Maverick has been subjected to a distributed denial of service (DDoS) attack,” the publication said on X (formerly Twitter).

” A DDoS attack is described as a malicious attempt to disrupt the normal traffic of a targeted server, network or website by overwhelming the target or its surrounding infrastructure with a flood of internet traffic,” it explained.

“Several hours ago, the site suddenly went down. We picked it up very quickly and started identifying a massive distributed denial of service (DDoS) attack. We investigated and found it was coming from a whole host of Indian servers,” said Daily Maverick’s security coordinator at 11:30 pm IST on Wednesday.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-009: Scammers steal $500m from tax office
Incident Description: Fraudsters have used hacked credentials to claim more than half a billion dollars from the tax office, by creating false myGov accounts and linking them to the files of genuine taxpayers.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-008:Outlook.com hit by outages as hacktivists claim DDoS attacks
Incident Description: Outlook.com hit by outages as hacktivists claim DDoS attacks

Entry Title: WHID 2023-007: Terra.money Freezes Website Amid Phishing Scam Concerns
Incident Description: In a bid to safeguard its users from ongoing phishing attacks, Terra.money has taken the proactive step of freezing its website temporarily. The attackers managed to compromise the Terra website and exploited it for phishing scams, endangering the platform’s users. In response, Terra swiftly froze its domains associated with the platform, halting the proliferation of user-targeted phishing scams.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-006: Clorox takes servers offline, notifies law enforcement after ‘unauthorized activity’
Incident Description:
Cleaning product giant Clorox announced a cybersecurity incident this week that forced it to take several systems offline.

The company – which reported more than $7 billion in earnings in 2022 through its namesake cleaning product and several others like Pine Sol, Burt’s Bees and more – reported the incident in regulatory filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Monday.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-005: Canada vows more military aid for Ukraine as PM's website hacked
Incident Description:
The prime minister's official website on Tuesday morning showed a "service is unavailable" error when checked by Reuters. Trudeau said the cyber attacks were an "unsurprising" act by Russian hackers.

"We are aware of reports that some Government of Canada websites have been offline," a spokesperson for Canada's Communications Security Establishment (CSE) said in a statement, and echoed Trudeau's comment that it not an uncommon occurrence in countries hosting visits by Ukrainian government officials.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-004: Hackers target over 1,000 Indian websites as part of malicious Independence Day campaign
Incident Description: Cybersecurity researchers disclosed on Friday that a group of hackers had aimed their sights at more than 1,000 Indian websites as part of a campaign aligned with Independence Day, tagged as OpIndia. The orchestrated effort involved hacktivist collectives from diverse nations and employed a variety of techniques, including Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks, defacement assaults, and takeovers of user accounts, as detailed by the CloudSEK team.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-003: Hackers target over 1,000 Indian websites as part of malicious Independence Day campaign
Incident Description: Cybersecurity researchers disclosed on Friday that a group of hackers had aimed their sights at more than 1,000 Indian websites as part of a campaign aligned with Independence Day, tagged as OpIndia. The orchestrated effort involved hacktivist collectives from diverse nations and employed a variety of techniques, including Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks, defacement assaults, and takeovers of user accounts, as detailed by the CloudSEK team.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-002: Hackers target over 1,000 Indian websites as part of malicious Independence Day campaign
Incident Description: Cybersecurity researchers disclosed on Friday that a group of hackers had aimed their sights at more than 1,000 Indian websites as part of a campaign aligned with Independence Day, tagged as OpIndia. The orchestrated effort involved hacktivist collectives from diverse nations and employed a variety of techniques, including Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks, defacement assaults, and takeovers of user accounts, as detailed by the CloudSEK team.

Entry Title: WHID 2023-001: Has Trump’s Patriot Defense Legal Fund Website Been Hacked?
Incident Description: The Patriot Legal Defense Fund website, seemingly established to support aides and employees of former President Donald Trump with their rapidly increasing legal expenses, has been hacked. The home page has been defaced to strike through Trump’s name and add an “America Is Already Great!” strapline. But the hacker has altered far more than just the banner.

Entry Title: WHID 2019-003: Official Fortnite Twitter account has been hacked
Incident Description: Well, it appears that the hate for Epic Games’ recent decisions has led to some individual taking inappropriate measures against the official Fortnite Twitter account.

Entry Title: WHID 2019-002: Ticketmaster Breach Part of Massive Payment Card Hacking Campaign
Incident Description: Threat actor Magecart has infiltrated over 800 e-commerce sites with card skimming software installed on third-party software components, RiskIQ says.

Entry Title: WHID 2019-001: MyPillow and Amerisleep wake up to Magecart card theft nightmare
Incident Description: MyPillow and Amerisleep are both popular mattresses and bedding merchants in the United States. While their websites boast the best deals around for a proper night's sleep, what is lacking is an acknowledgment of two separate security incidents potentially impacting their customers -- incidents which RiskIQ says took place as far back as 2017.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-014:Reddit doesn’t support 2FA – a hacker just proved why it should
Incident Description: A hacker who’s spent the last two weeks hijacking Reddit moderator accounts and defacing their subreddit pages appears to be doing it partly to make a point about Reddit’s security, and also just because he can.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-013: Hacker convicted for infiltrating Country Liberals' website
Incident Description: The then-18-year old used a SQL database command attack, known as SQL injection, to unlawfully access the online membership application section of the site.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-012: Traceable data 'stolen from fetish forum'
Incident Description: A hardcore fetish web forum has been hacked, with more than 100,000 accounts exposed, according to a prominent security researcher.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-011: Customer data hacked from Kiddicare 'test' website
Incident Description: Kiddicare, the nursery supplies retailer acquired and discarded by supermarket Morrisons, has admitted that almost 800,000 customers' details were stolen in a data breach dating back to November 2015.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-010: Hackers halt Utkal varsity’s e-admissions
Incident Description: The official website of Odisha’s oldest university, Utkal University, was Tuesday hacked for the second time in a week forcing officials to shut down the e-admission process. Although it wasn’t clear if the hackers stole any information, the website was defaced and the page showed a group called ‘Pak Cyber Attackers’ to be responsible for the attack. - See more at: http://indianexpress.com/article/india/india-news-india/hackers-halt-utkal-varsitys-e-admissions-2794346/#sthash.UYkwpg8k.dpuf

Entry Title: WHID 2016-009: Domo Arigato: White hat reports vulnerability on Mr. Robot website
Incident Description: It couldn't have been scripted any better. The new promotional website for season two of the USA Network's computer hacking drama Mr. Robotrequired an emergency patch after a white-hat hacker discovered a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability, according to a report from Forbes.com.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-008: Homeland Security warns of hackers exploiting SAP security flaw
Incident Description: Homeland Security has warned that hackers are exploiting a security vulnerability in SAP business software -- a flaw that dates back to 2010.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-007: Anonymous teams up with GhostSquad to attack major banks
Incident Description: Anonymous has joined forces with GhostSquad to launch successful cyberattacks on eight international banks that were forced to shut down their websites. The hacktivist collective alongside the hacker group GhostSquad have launched a new operation called Op Icarus which aims to punish corrupt banks and individuals in the financial sector.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-006: Kaziranga website hacked by Pak youth
Incident Description: Kaziranga National Park authorities on Monday said the official website of the park had been hacked by a Pakistan-based hacker.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-005: IRCTC Website Hacked- Over 10 Million Accounts Hacked
Incident Description: IRCTC, Indian railway’s official website has been hacked today. All the transaction and ticket booking are usually done through this portal. The hack has been confirmed by the government and news portals.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-004: Donald Trump Campaign Website Down For An Hour, Hackers Claim Responsibility
Incident Description: After the campaign website for Republican presidential hopeful Donald Trump went down Saturday morning, an online hacker collective – which has said it focuses on targeting online activity of the Islamic State group, also known as ISIS – claimed responsibility, CBS News reported

Entry Title: WHID 2016-003: Linode Is Under a Barrage of DDoS Attacks Since Christmas
Incident Description: VPS cloud hosting provider Linode has been experiencing outages due to distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks for the past few days, with the first attacks starting on Christmas Eve.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-002: Palembang District Court Website Hacked as a Show of Protest
Incident Description: The official website of Palembang District Court (http://pn-palembang.go.id) was reportedly hacked as a show of protest by the hacker against the ruling made the court that rejected the lawsuit filed by the government against PT Bumi Mekar Hijau, which was allegedly involved in the case of forest fire in South Sumatera province.

Entry Title: WHID 2016-001: Religiously Motivated Hacker Defaces 79 Escort Sites
Incident Description: A Moroccan hacker that calls himself ElSurveillance has defaced and stolen data from 79 escort websites, as part of a larger campaign he started last summer, a campaign against adult and escort portals.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-063: Hong Kong Free Press hit by denial-of-service attack weeks before launch
Incident Description: Hong Kong Free Press, an independent news website set up to counter falling press freedom in the territory, has been hit by a denial-of-service attack before the platform has launched

Entry Title: WHID 2015-062: Businessman Loses $240,000 to Hackers
Incident Description: A targeted attack on a businessman from Mahwah, New Jersey, caused the victim a financial loss of $240,000 / €215,000, through a bank transfer request that appeared legitimate to the financial institution.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-061: Local websites hacked after a brute force attack
Incident Description: Web Design 309, a local web design firm, says the hackers used a brute force attack to break into a local server, using millions of password combinations at the same time until one of them worked.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-060: Hackers attack Huffington Post, other sites, with malware-laced ads
Incident Description: The Huffington Post and several major websites displayed malware-laced advertisements that infected computers and locked them down.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-059: 'Self-XSS' flaw in found Microsoft Dynamics CRM
Incident Description: A flaw discovered in Microsoft's Dynamics CRM could allow remote hackers to trick a logged-in user into inserting malicious code within input fields on vulnerable websites.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-058: Stealthy 'XOR.DDoS' trojan infects Linux systems, installs rootkit
Incident Description: A newly discovered trojan is infecting Linux systems and possibly building up an arsenal of devices to be used in distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks

Entry Title: WHID 2015-057: Hackers with ties to Islamic State group take over Buena Park nonprofit's website
Incident Description: Giving Children Hope, a nonprofit that delivers aid to children and families in need around the world, had its website hacked by a group identifying itself as Team System Dz, an Islamic State sympathizer.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-056: Bulgarian Energy Regulator’s Website Hacked
Incident Description: Initially the cyberattack had only affected the homepage of www.dker.bg, with access to the site being restricted completely at around 9.30 AM CET on Thursday

Entry Title: WHID 2015-055: Merkel website hacked ahead of visit by Ukrainian premier
Incident Description: A German official says Chancellor Angela Merkel's website and several other German government sites have been blocked, and a pro-Russian organization has claimed responsibility.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-054: Md. station's Twitter, website hacked by ISIS supporters
Incident Description: The Twitter account for WBOC, a Salisbury-based television station, was hijacked Tuesday by a hacker claiming to be sympathetic to the Islamic State terrorist group.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-053: Primary school website hacked by Islamic extremists
Incident Description: The homepage of Sowerby Community Primary School in Yorkshire was taken over by messages of hate against America and Israel

Entry Title: WHID 2015-052: iCloud hole closed following brute force attack
Incident Description: A hole in iCloud's security allowed attackers to access any iCloud account via a brute force attack that side-stepped blocks - but it is now reported to have been patched.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-051: Weasel Zippers attacked, taken down for 12 hours
Incident Description: DDoS attack for 12 hours.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-050: University Of Cape CoastOfficial Website Hacked
Incident Description: The official website of the University Of Cape Coast has been taken down

Entry Title: WHID 2015-049: Bitstamp exchange hacked, $5M worth of bitcoin stolen
Incident Description: The European bitcoin exchange suspends its service after it was hacked, ZDNet can confirm. Less than 19,000 bitcoins were stolen from an operational wallet.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-048: OP hit by another denial of service attack
Incident Description: The second attack was detected on Sunday afternoon, only a couple of hours after the first attack had ended, according to an announcement posted by the financial services provider on its Facebook page.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-047: Finnish bank takes cricket bat to wave after wave of DDoS varmints
Incident Description: Finnish bank OP is continuing to fight off a cascading series of distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks that began on New Year's Eve.

Incident Description: DB Dump

Incident Description: After the hacking last week, the umbrella body has been unable to restore its website to working order, and does not know why it has been targeted

Entry Title: WHID 2015-044: Website of Bulgaria's Energy Watchdog Hacked
Incident Description: Hackers have taken down the website of DKEVR, the Bulgarian energy regulator. - See more at: http://www.novinite.com/articles/165828/Website+of+Bulgaria%27s+Energy+Watchdog+Hacked#sthash.zKOcddf7.dpuf

Incident Description: DB Dump

Incident Description: Last week, we hacked the servers of Temporis, allegedly France’s largest network of franchised temp work agencies (www.temporis-franchise.fr).

Entry Title: WHID 2015-041: Victor Valley College hit by computer security breach
Incident Description: The entire Victor Valley College Information Technology Department has been placed on paid administrative leave while campus police and an outside company investigate a breach in security protocol, President Roger Wagner said Thursday.

Incident Description: DB Dump

Entry Title: WHID 2015-035: U. Chicago hacked
Incident Description: It appears we should add the University of Chicago to schools hacked by Carbonic. And yes, chalk it up to another SQLi vulnerability.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-034: Ghana government websites targeted by hackers
Incident Description: The majority of the Ghanaian government's websites, including its main site, have been hacked and are currently offline.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-033: Le Monde hacked: 'Je ne suis pas Charlie' writes Syrian Electronic Army
Incident Description: Hackers from the Syrian Electronic Army, which supports Syrian President Bashar al-Assad, broke into the Twitter account of Le Monde overnight, the newspaper confirmed on Wednesday.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-032: Alleged Islamic hackers target NZ websites
Incident Description: At least two New Zealand websites have been hacked and defaced by a group calling themselves the 'Team Muslim Cyberforce'.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-031: Aussie Travel Cover hack exposes details of 770,000 customers

Incident Description: DB dump

Entry Title: WHID 2015-029: DDoS Attacks Slam Finnish Bank
Incident Description: Police in Finland are investigating a series of distributed denial-of-service attacks against the country's OP Pohjola financial services group that have intermittently shut down online banking and direct debit services

Entry Title: WHID 2015-027: Virginia county website defaced with Islamic State message
Incident Description: A Virginia county was the victim of a cyber attack where a group posted messages and videos praising ISIS, the rebel Islamic group that has leveled threats against the United States. - See more at: http://statescoop.com/virginia-county-website-defaced-islamic-state-messages/#sthash.C2MeEh4O.dpuf

Entry Title: WHID 2015-026: Grill parts website experiences system intrusion, payment card breach
Incident Description: From January 2014 to October 2014, cardholder data was exposed on three separate occasions for various lengths of time due to a cyber attack against Barbecue Renew's web server.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-025: Hacker breached Metropolitan State University database with personal info
Incident Description: In a campuswide e-mail Friday, interim president Devinder Malhotra wrote that a computer hacker apparently got “unauthorized access” to the university database in mid-December, and that investigators are still trying to determine the scope of the data breach.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-024: FREE SYRIAN HACKERS HACKS OHIO CITY’S WEBSITE
Incident Description: Free Syrian Hacker Dr.SHA6H hacked and defaced the official Ohio City Website of Perrysburg. He left a message to the defaced page with a message bashing the governments of the world for not solving the Syrian Crisis.

Entry Title: WHID 2015-023: 19,000 French websites hit by DDoS, defaced in wake of terror attack
Incident Description: Since the three day terror attack that started in France on January 7 with the attack on satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo, 19,000 websites of French-based companies have been targeted by cyber attackers, AP reports.

Incident Description: DB dumped on PasteBin
